snippet: John Scott, whom the Rangers acquired before the trade deadline, admits “it’s kind of eerie” to follow in the footsteps of his close friend Derek Boogaard, who died last year.
abstract: New York Rangers center John Scott, acquired just before the trade deadline, admits that it is unsettling to follow in the footsteps of his close friend Derek Boogaard, who died in 2011, in filling the role of team's enforcer.

byline.contributor: Jeff Z. Klein contributed reporting from Greenburgh, N.Y.

lead_paragraph: John Scott, whom the Rangers acquired before the trade deadline, admits “it’s kind of eerie” to follow in the footsteps of his close friend Derek Boogaard, who died last year.

headline.seo: Rangers’ New Enforcer Still Misses the Old One
headline.main: Rangers’ New Enforcer Still Misses Old One
headline.print_headline: Rangers’ New Enforcer Still Misses Old One
